LOS 54.c
Asset-backed securities (ABS) can be a single class of securities or multiple classes with
differing claims to the cash flows from the underlying assets. Time tranching refers to
classes that receive the principal payments from underlying securities sequentially as each
prior tranche is repaid in full. With credit tranching, any credit losses are first absorbed
by the tranche with the lowest priority, and after that by any other subordinated
tranches, in order. Some structures have both time tranching and credit tranching.
